title: Adipose-Derived Stem Cell Treatment
description: Mini-liposuction harvests your own stem cells, we concentrate them in our lab, and Dr Abbas guides them back into the joints and tendons that refuse to heal.
longDescription: Stem cell therapy is the London answer for people stuck between painkillers and surgery. We gently harvest adipose tissue from the abdomen or flanks, isolate millions of mesenchymal stem cells—100x more than bone marrow—and reinfuse them into arthritic joints or stubborn tendon tears under ultrasound guidance. Each protocol includes lab testing, sedation, and a personalised rehab plan so the renewed tissue actually learns how to move again.

hero.headline: Stem Cells That Keep You Moving

overview.title: Why Adipose Stem Cells Work
overview.content: Fat tissue is a rich, gentle source of mesenchymal stem cells. When we reinfuse these cells into a degenerative joint, they orchestrate repair: calming cytokines, building new collagen, and recruiting your own healing cells. It’s ideal for moderate arthritis, labral tears, tendinopathy, and chronic inflammation when PRP is no longer enough.
highlights: Mini-liposuction harvest with local anaesthetic + light sedation
100–1000x more stem cells than a same-volume bone marrow draw
Targets cartilage, tendons, ligaments, and chronic inflammatory pain

suitable: Moderate osteoarthritis with preserved joint space

Recurrent inflammatory flares despite PRP or steroids
candidacy.note: Comprehensive bloodwork and imaging are required before scheduling.

faq.question: Is the harvest painful?
faq.answer: We use local anaesthetic and twilight sedation. You may feel gentle tugging but discomfort is minimal and bruising fades within a few days.

faq.question: When will I notice results?
faq.answer: Inflammation settles first at 4–6 weeks; strength and confidence build from the 12-week mark as collagen and cartilage remodel.

faq.question: How long do results last?
faq.answer: Most patients enjoy 12–36 months of relief. Annual check-ins help determine if a PRP or stem cell booster is needed.

faq.question: Can I combine this with other treatments?
faq.answer: Yes. We often layer stem cells with PRP, Arthrosamid®, or physiotherapy to create cushioning, regeneration, and strength at the same time.

schema.howPerformed: A small volume of adipose tissue is harvested via mini-liposuction under local anaesthetic and light sedation. The tissue is processed in a sterile centrifuge to isolate mesenchymal stem cells, which are reinjected under ultrasound guidance into damaged joints or tendons.
schema.preparation: Comprehensive bloodwork, MRI or ultrasound imaging, hydration, and no anti-inflammatories for seven days. Wear loose clothing for the harvest site.
schema.followup: 48-hour rest followed by progressive physiotherapy. Formal reviews at 6 and 12 weeks with optional booster planning.
schema.outcome: Reduced inflammation, improved joint cushioning, enhanced tendon strength, and delayed need for surgery.
schema.medicationRequired: Local anaesthetic with optional oral sedation
schema.treatmentFrequency: Typically single session with optional booster at 6–12 months
schema.adverseOutcome: Temporary soreness or bruising at harvest and injection sites.
